pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.16.1: Sp 2.886: _Sacepi udakasāṭikacīvaraṁ mahagghaṁ hoti, na sakkā nivāsetvā bahi gantuṁ, evampi naggāya nhāyituṁ vaṭṭati_; “Also, if her bathing robe is valuable, or she is unable to put on a lower robe before going outside, then it is allowable to bathe naked.” The implication of this is that this rule concerns outdoor bathing, which fits the origin story.
